intro: Centropogon flos-mutisii f. fuscoviridis, commonly known as the dark-green centropogon, is a rare variant of the centropogon genus. It is characterized by its dark green foliage, which distinguishes it from the typical green form of the species. The plant is a flowering herbaceous species native to specific regions in South America. It features small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts.
